bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from H. A. Taylor to Henry Rose Carter, March 1, 1905

div1.p: Taylor encloses a letter thanking Carter for his attention to the yellow fever outbreak on board the U.S.S. Boston.

div1.head: Letter from H. A. Taylor to Henry Rose Carter, March 1, 1905
div1.opener:
SURGEON-GENERAL
PUBLIC HEALTH AND MARINE-HOSPITAL SERVICE
AMW
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
WASHINGTON
AMW
March 1, 1905.
Surgeon H.R. Carter, P.H. & M.H.S.,
Ancon, Canal Zone, Isthmus of Panama.
Sir:
div1.p:
A letter from the Secretary of the Navy, addressed to your-
self, thanking you for your efficient work in combating the re-
cent yellow fever outbreak on board the U.S.S. BOSTON, at Panama,
is herewith transmitted.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, H. A. Taylor Assistant Secretary.
A.H.G.
Inclosure.
